website_summaries.verdict: The Oki B431DN is truly a workhorse black-and-white laser printer, with rapid output speed and high print quality. Combined with extra features like an autoduplexer and a large paper input capacity, the Oki B431DN is worth your dollar.
pros: Impressive output speed and print quality

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer and fast
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fast and economical black/white/greyscale printer for home/college use and went for this OKI. I've had it for around 2 years now and still haven't had to change the toner cartridge. It does a great job with letters, papers, and graphics. It warms up fast and prints quickly. Advanced power options save electricity and it has an easy to follow LCD menu screen. I have no complaints with the machine. I did have a bit of confusion downloading the latest driver for it from OKI's website. Once I was sure it was the right one the printer is pretty much flawless. Great basic laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: S.T. JUSTICE

customer_reviews.title: Good to go....
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I go to school. She is finishing her phd and I am finishing my master. We both knew we need a reliable printer that would provide enough copies without hurting our pockets. We found the oki B 431ND.. This is great printer. It is very fast, responsive , and clean. I couldn't ask for more. Maybe, I could ask for a wifi connection. That would make things much easier than using your USB connection. I love the double side print, it makes me save even more. Well I hope this helps for the next buyer. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: RossdelFlores

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer works as good as any printer I have ever used and it did not cost much. In addition it's operating cost is very low. I bought it because my hp 2500dn color laserjet quite working and it needed new cartridges (which cost about the same as a new color laserjet.) It is also much less expensive to operate then a Canon i9900 color inkjet that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Schlappi

customer_reviews.title: Great Laser Printer for Home or Office
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older one, same model. It worked great right out of the box. The OEM supplies are a must though. Aftermarket toner and drums don't hold up, if they even work (for this printer anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Broke (cover closing) before first print. 2 hours with ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke (cover closing) before first print. 2 hours with tech support finding a driver that would work. No satisfaction with extended warrenty.. Using with brick to keep cover closed.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Slow start up, fast PPM.
customer_reviews.text: PPM is great, but start up NOT as fast as stated. Takes at least 10 seconds from clicking print to it printing unless you've printed something else within the last 20 seconds or so. It goes into a type of sleep mode and takes forever to warm back up to print a new job. Like everything else about it, very efficient, seems to last a long time. LOVE that it's LED. Just REALLY wish the time to print was faster!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Mohelski

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Printer for Price
customer_reviews.text: Best $ ever spent! I highly recommend this for any home office even if only occasional print jobs. I love this printer so much that I put one on my desk at my office (against IT rules) and I will be purchasing a second one for my home office soon
customer_reviews.author: Saundra

customer_reviews.title: Any other printer you buy will be better than this
customer_reviews.text: Horrible piece of junk. Overpriced, lousy print quality, convoluted toner interface, crapped out way too early. Do not buy. I can't remember being more disappointed in a product. I get mad just thinking about it.
customer_reviews.author: Waquoit

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old HP 4000 with this unit. Set up only took a minute. The print quality is much better than the HP and it's much faster as well. For the price, you can't go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: Warren E. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive everyday text printer.
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for everyday black and white text documents. Not for pictures . The ink has a very long life.
customer_reviews.author: guido

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer for my classroom and I'm so glad I did. It's quiet and printing is fast. Copy quality is great. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Yates

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: So Far it has been a real pleasure and the customer support is perfect. Very Fast Printer, for sure. I recommend this as a black and white cost effective alternative to the cheap printers that break fast and cost a fortune in INK.
customer_reviews.author: joshua a pfeil

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase in awhile!
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing purchase that has incredible speed for page printing and does not have any printing issues. The double sided printing is awesome as pages feed back in and come out with two page print. I literally watch it print and feel happiness at the ease with which I can do my tasks and the ease with which it tackles them.
customer_reviews.author: G-train

customer_reviews.title: Dead printer after just over 1 year of use
customer_reviews.text: Just a little after 12 months the printer is dead. Code "134 LED" error is either the motherboard or LED printhead. Out of warranty cost is $252 for them just to look at but you have to ship it back to them at your cost. It costs new $250 on Amazon, so since it's out of warranty, it's now a 30 lb. paperweight. Even when working the print quality was just okay. The print drivers were also nothing to write home about (difficult to install and limited options/features). Also the drum unit seems to wear out quickly. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Huie

customer_reviews.title: Works as Promised
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and smooth, fast operation. It does everything exactly as promised by the favorable reviews I read. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a little slow for the first page, but the rest pages come very fast.
customer_reviews.author: amjby63

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Fast and easy to use. Oki Data's the best.
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus S Kush

customer_reviews.title: Loving this printer. Still needing to learn more about ...
customer_reviews.text: Loving this printer. Still needing to learn more about it.
customer_reviews.author: David Bergh

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I have been involved with the publishing industry for many years, and have used many printers, but this is by far the best. It is sharp, clear, and fast, even when printing duplex pages. I plan on buying more of them for our offices, now that I've tried this one out at home.
customer_reviews.author: domcomm

customer_reviews.title: great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer. It always works, no clogging jams. When not used a lot, the wheels do make some noise. The plastic paper tray could be made a little more sturdy. But great print and constant!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth O. Golowenski

customer_reviews.title: Okidata printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a personal printer that gets a lot of use by our controller. It duplexes and prints quickly. We have had it for 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It''s a little clunky and noisy but it serves its purpose. It is fast and the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Mahaffey

customer_reviews.title: This Printer Functions Adequately
customer_reviews.text: This printer functions adequately. I have, so far, not encountered any significant issues or any other noteworthy details to share.
customer_reviews.author: KRIS HIEBERT

customer_reviews.title: Good Printrr So Far
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good printer so far. I am concerned about the cost to replace the drum unit. Ok
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kutos

customer_reviews.title: David
customer_reviews.text: Run from this printer. I tried extensively to get this to work with a Dell Windows 7 computer without success. I have bought and connected numerous printers over the years and never had a problem until this one. It never worked despite downloads. I encountered hassles in returning. I intend to throw it in the trash and write off my investment. I will avoid Okidata products and Adorama.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: original printer was defective
customer_reviews.text: original printer was defective and cost me $$ b/c my IT guy needed to install it to find out it ran 2 copies and jammed every time. paper drawer closed very hard like it didn't fit. called adorama-they said i had to call oki. spent time convincing oki my printer could not be trouble shoot'd. oki finally made it right by replacing it. cost me printer plus IT installtion x 2. so far it only jams on the last page of a full drawer of paper
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Greg Nyffeler

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer one year ago and it worked fine for the first 6 months. For the last 6 months I have lived with terrible quality printing. Lines are present where they should not be, print is missing and the entire page has a light gray haze over it. It appear to need a new drum. Checking the printer usage menu it says the printer has 50% drum life remaining and that I have printed 12,758 pages. This is unacceptable. I had a HP 4100 printer for 20 years and never had problems like this. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: njmonte

customer_reviews.title: Not Wireless
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this printer. When it arrived I noticed that it was not wireless. It can be connected directly to a network via an 10/100 Ethernet wired connection, or it can be connected to a computer by means of a USB 2.0 or parallel port. I subsequently checked the Okidata site and it does not imply that it is wireless so I guess this is an Amazon error. [Link to Okidata site deleted by Amazon] Select the Specifications tab. If it were not for this oversite I would have given the printer five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Psi Star

customer_reviews.title: Broken printer
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken. Received a refund but it was a long hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real-life cost per page is not so very low, if the drum doesn't last....
customer_reviews.text: The price per page on this printer looks great, IF the drum really lasted for all the copies Okidata claims. Unfortunately, Okidata says the consumables are only warranted for 90 days. When our drum needed replacing at 63% life remaining, Okidata refused to discount a replacement, since the drum had been purchased 9 months earlier. The cost per page is much higher when you have to buy a new drum more than twice as often as you should.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this printer if you run WIndows 8
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a new computer that runs Windows 8. This printer went from being very fast on a Windows 7 machine to very slow on the Windows 8 machine. The Windows 8 driver does not appear to function correctly and Oki still has not fixed this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan D. Uslick

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy this Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer April 2013. I barely use it ( maybe 1-2 reams of paper I still use the original toner). I called okidata after some diagnostics they say they cpu needs to be replaced. They said my warrenty expired may 2014. I never had this happen to any HP printer i owned. They also said it may be cheaper to buy a new one
customer_reviews.author: Peter Agro

product_meta.title: Oki Data B431dn Black Digitral Mono Printer (40 ppm)
product_meta.description: If you’re looking to improve the productivity and lower the operating costs of your business, the B411/B431 Series offers all of that and more. For starters, select series models deliver up to 40 ppm, with the first page printing in less than 5 seconds.1 They produce output in black & white that’s clear and crisp, at up to 1200 x 1200 dpi resolution2, using a two-piece consumables system for long-lasting performance and a low cost of operation.
feature_bullets: As fast as 40 ppm print speed; 5-second time to first page1
Separate toner and image drum configuration for lower operating costs
Clear, crisp output at up to 1200 x 1200 dpi2

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars50 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
